intro: Malacothrix parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered malacothrix, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
